products.label: IBM Cloudability Enablement
products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cloudability
products.short_description: Add your IBM Cloud account or enterprise to IBM Cloudability to start analyzing and tracking all of your cloud expenses.
products.long_description:
Easily add your IBM Cloud account or enterprise to your IBM Cloudability account with this deployable architecture (DA). All of the necessary steps to add your IBM Cloud billing data to an existing IBM Cloudability account are managed for you using infrastructure as code (IaC). These steps include:

1. Creating a Key Protect encrypted Object Storage bucket to store your billing reports.
2. Enabling IBM Cloud [billing report exports](/docs/account?topic=account-exporting-your-usage&interface=ui) to receive billing reports updated daily.
3. Grant IBM Cloudability access to read the reports from the bucket
4. Add your IBM Cloud account to Cloudability.
5. Verify that the IBM Cloud integration with Cloudability is successful.

Your IBM Cloud billing data will begin showing up in IBM Cloudability the next day. 
If you don't have an IBM Cloudability account, then start by creating your [free trial](https://www.apptio.com/products/cloudability/#cldy-trial)
. If you have access to IBM Cloudability and are ready to add your IBM Cloud account, then start by [creating your access credentials](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning) and then [deploying with projects](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-deploy-cloud). 

For more details, refer to the [Cloudability Enablement deployment guide](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability) for more information.

features.title: Store your latest IBM Cloud billing reports in Cloud Object Storage
features.description: Cloudability reads CSV billing reports from an Object Storage bucket for each account in your enterprise. The billing reports are updated daily.

features.title: Secured with Key Protect
features.description: Your Object Storage bucket containing billing reports is encrypted with a Key Protect encryption key with automated rotation. See [encrypting a bucket with Key Protect](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-tutorial-kp-encrypt-bucket) for more details.

features.title: Least Privileged Operations to Cloudability
features.description: Custom IAM access roles are used so that Cloudability is granted the minimal required access to integrate with your IBM Cloud Account.

features.title: Track cloud expense for your entire enterprise
features.description: Deploying in your main Enterprise account will automatically add any existing and future accounts in your enterprise to IBM Cloudability. By adding your billing data to Cloudability, your organization can organize, monitor, and analyze your expenses for all your accounts.

features.title: Integration validation
features.description: Verifies that the integration to IBM Cloudability is successful so you are confident that the integration is setup correctly.

features.title: Observability
features.description: Integration with monitoring and audit logging is enabled by default.

profile.name: IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services

diagrams.description: IBM Cloud Billing writes billing reports to a Key Protect encrypted object storage bucket. IBM Cloudability is granted access to read the billing reports from this bucket which are updated daily. Your IBM Cloud account is added to Cloudability so that it is aware of the object storage bucket to pull the billing data from. Optionally, monitoring and activity events are sent to IBM Cloud Monitoring and IBM Cloud Logs respectively to be able to audit access to the object storage bucket. For more details visit the [reference architecture documentation](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-cloudability-enablement)

features.title: Easily add your IBM Cloud account
features.description: Use automation to reliably and consistently perform all of steps to add your IBM Cloud account to an existing IBM Cloudability account.

features.title: Integration validation
features.description: Verifies that the integration to IBM Cloudability is successful so you are confident that the integration is setup correctly.

features.title: Observability
features.description: Integration with monitoring and audit logging is enabled by default.

configuration.description: The IBM Cloud API key corresponding to the cloud account that is to be added to Cloudability. For enterprise accounts, create the api key in the primary enterprise account in order to add all child accounts within your enterprise. See [configuring IBM Cloud IAM permissions](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning#cloudability-iam-prereqs)

Select Cloudability authentication mode. Options are:

* `none`: no connection to Cloudability
* `manual`: manually enter in the credentials in the Cloudability UI
* `api_key`: use Cloudability API Keys
* `frontdoor`: Frontdoor Access Administration

Cloudability API Key used to authenticate with Cloudability to add the IBM Cloud account to the Cloudability environment. See [how to retrieve your Cloudability API key](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning#api-key) or visit the [cloudability preferences page](https://app.apptio.com/cloudability#/settings/preferences). 
Required if `cloudability_auth_type` is set to `api_key`.

Public key that is used along with the `frontdoor_secret_key` to authenticate requests to Cloudability. See [acquiring an Access Administration API key](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning#frontdoor-api-key) for steps to create your credentials. Required if `cloudability_auth_type` is `frontdoor`

Secret key that is used along with the `frontdoor_public_key` to authenticate requests to Cloudability. See [acquiring an Access Administration API key](/docs/track-spend-with-cloudability?topic=track-spend-with-cloudability-planning#frontdoor-api-key) for steps to create your credentials. Required if `cloudability_auth_type` is `frontdoor`.
An ID corresponding to the Cloudability environment. Required if `cloudability_auth_type` is `frontdoor`.

IBM Cloudability hostname which depends on the region where Cloudability is created. See [Cloudability API documentation](https://help.apptio.com/en-us/cloudability/api/v3/getting%20started%20with%20the%20cloudability.htm)

Whether to verify that the IBM Cloud account is successfully integrated with Cloudability. This step is not strictly necessary for adding the account to Cloudability. Only applicable when `cloudability_auth_type` is `api_key`.
Region where resources are created. Only us-south, eu-de and jp-tok have [Key protect failover support](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/key-protect?topic=key-protect-ha-dr#availability)
Whether the account corresponding to the `ibmcloud_api_key` is an enterprise account and, if so, is the primary account within the enterprise
The ID of the enterprise. If `__NULL__` then it is automatically retrieved if `is_enterprise_account` is `true`. Providing this value reduces the access policies that are required to run the DA.
Whether the value of `resource_group_name` input is a new (true) or an existing (false) resource group
The name of a new or existing resource group (depends on `use_existing_resource_group`) where resources are created.
List of access tags to be added to the created resources
List of tags to be added to created resources
Whether each update overwrites the existing report version or a new version of the report is created leaving the existing report
Directory for your accounts billing report objects in the object storage bucket
The ID of an existing Object Storage instance. If `__NULL__` then a new instance is created.
The name of the newly created Cloud Object storage instance which contains the billing reports bucket. Only used if `existing_cos_instance_id` is not defined.
Name of the cloud object storage (COS) bucket where billing reports are stored
Add a randomly generated suffix (4 characters long) to the `bucket_name` to ensure global uniqueness.
Plan to be used for creating Cloud Object Storage instance. Only used if `existing_cos_instance_id` is not defined.
Specifies the number of days when the expire rule action takes effect. [Learn more](/docs/cloud-object-storage?topic=cloud-object-storage-expiry)
The storage class of the newly provisioned Object Storage bucket of a `standard` or `lite` plan instance. Not required for one rate instances.
Enable object versioning to keep multiple versions of an object in the object storage bucket
Specifies the number of days when the archive rule action takes effect. A value of `__NULL__` disables archiving. A value of `0` immediately archives uploaded objects to the bucket.
Specifies the storage class or archive type to which you want the object to transition.
The type of endpoint for the IBM terraform provider to use to manage the bucket. (public, private, or direct)
The CRN of an existing Key Protect or Hyper Protect Crypto Services instance to be used to create the Object Storage encryption key.

Whether to skip the creation of an IAM authorization policy that permits the Object Storage instance to read the encryption key from the Key Protect instance.
**WARNING**: An authorization policy must exist before an encrypted bucket can be created.
Name of the Key Protect instance that stores the Object Storage encryption key. Not needed if `existing_kms_instance_crn` is used.
Name of the Key Protect key ring to store the Object Storage encryption key.
Whether the `key_ring_name` corresponds to an existing key ring or a new key ring for storing the encryption key
Name of the Key Protect key for encryption of the Object Storage bucket. If `__NULL__` then the name of the Object Storage bucket is used instead.
If set to true, Key Protect enables a rotation policy on the Key Protect instance.
Specifies the number of months for the encryption key to be rotated.. Must be between 1 and 12 inclusive.
The type of endpoint to be used for management of key protect.
If set to `true`, all Object Storage bucket read events (downloads) are sent to Activity Tracker.
If set to true, all Object Storage bucket write events (uploads) are sent to Activity Tracker.
If set to true, all Object Storage management events are sent to Activity Tracker.

The CRN of an IBM Cloud Monitoring instance to send Object Storage bucket metrics to. If no value is passed, metrics are sent to the instance associated to the container's location unless otherwise specified in the Metrics Router service configuration.
If set to `true`, all Object Storage bucket request metrics are sent to the monitoring service.
If set to `true`, all Object Storage bucket usage metrics are sent to the monitoring service.
Name of the custom role that is used to grant the Cloudability service ID read access to the billing reports within the Object Storage bucket
Name of the custom role to grant access to a Cloudability service ID to read the enterprise information. Only used of `is_enterprise_account` is set to `true`.
